textInputs.label: Tx Channel
textInputs.description: Set Tx (or Pulse) channel.  The value in the text input box should be a 1-byte integer, and it will be passed as parameter 1 in the command.

textInputs.label: Tx Voltage
textInputs.description: Set Tx (Pulse) voltage value.  0x00 - 0x1f.  BE CAREFUL.  The value in the text input box should be a 1-byte integer, and it will be passed as parameter 1 in the command.

textInputs.label: Rx Channel
textInputs.description: Set Rx channel.  The value in the text input box should be a 1-byte integer, and it will be passed as parameter 1 in the command.

textInputs.label: Rx Gain
textInputs.description: Set Rx gain value.  0x00 - 0x0f.  The value in the text input box should be a 1-byte integer, and it will be passed as parameter 1 in the command.

textInputs.label: Rx Delay
textInputs.description: Set Rx Delay in 30 microseconds.  0x00 - 0x03.  0x00 is about an rx delay, as of this writing, of 2x 80MHz clocks.  For each additional +1, add 30 microseconds.  The maximum value corresponds to a delay of about 90 microseconds.

buttons.title: Set Tx Voltage via DAC Output to 0x00 (zero-est)
buttons.description: Set Tx or Pulse voltage via the DAC output to near-est possible zero.

buttons.title: Set Tx Voltage via DAC Output to 0x05 (Med)
buttons.description: Set Tx or Pulse voltage via the DAC output to around middle range when using a -200VDC module with source VDD of 3.3VDC rail.

buttons.title: Set Tx Voltage via DAC Output to 0x0f (Nominal Normal)
buttons.description: Set Tx or Pulse voltage via the DAC output to around designated nominal range when using a -200VDC module with source VDD of 3.3VDC rail.

buttons.title: Set Tx Channel 1
buttons.description: Set Tx channel to 1

buttons.title: Set Tx Channel 2
buttons.description: Set Tx channel to 1

buttons.title: Set Rx Channel 1
buttons.description: Set Rx channel to 1 (parameter1 = 0x01 - firmware handles the base 0x00 = Ch 1 part)

buttons.title: Set Rx Channel 2
buttons.description: Set Rx channel to 2 (parameter = 0x02 - firmware handles the base 0x00 = Ch 1 part

buttons.title: Set Rx Channel 3
buttons.description: Set Rx channel to 2 (parameter = 0x02 - firmware handles the base 0x00 = Ch 1 part

buttons.title: Set Rx Channel 4
buttons.description: Set Rx channel to 2 (parameter = 0x02 - firmware handles the base 0x00 = Ch 1 part

buttons.title: Set Rx Gain to 0 (Min)
buttons.description: Set Rx Gain to 0, the minimum

buttons.title: Set Rx Gain to 0x0F (Max)
buttons.description: Set Rx Gain to 0x0F, the maximum

buttons.title: Set PAQ Mode Single and Get a PAQ WF
buttons.description: Set PAQ mode to single pulse and acquire

buttons.title: Set PAQ Mode Continuous
buttons.description: Set PAQ mode to continuous acquisition

buttons.title: Set PAQ Mode Continuous Channel Scan
buttons.description: Set PAQ mode to continuous acquisition while channel-change scanning all channels

buttons.title: Get ADC Sample
buttons.description: Get a basic ADC sample from the re-purposed programming pin (after program, pin is re-purposed). Currently RB6 or PGC.  Currently pin 5 in the programming header. 10-bit max of 1023.  Please see cautions and notes regarding implementation in the MCU code.

buttons.title: Activate Bridge Relay (W/JP=NC => Bridge Open/Off)
buttons.description: arg1 = (RLY_CMD=0x0B)|(BRIDGE_BIT = 0x20)  and arg2 = specific relay if used

buttons.title: Deactivate Bridge Relay (W/JP=NC => Bridge Closed/On)
buttons.description: arg1 = (RLY_CMD=0x0B)|(BRIDGE_BIT = 0x20)  and arg2 = specific relay if used

buttons.title: Get N2E Voltage - Activate Bridge Relay Attenuated
buttons.description: arg2 = (N2E = 0x01) | (BRIDGE_BIT = 0x80) | (ATTEN_BIT = 0x40)

buttons.title: Get N2E Voltage - Activate Bridge Relay No Attenuation
buttons.description: arg2 = (N2E = 0x01) | (BRIDGE_BIT = 0x80) | (ATTEN_BIT = 0x40)

buttons.title: Get N2S Voltage - Activate Bridge Relay No Attenuation
buttons.description: arg2 = (N2S = 0x02) | (BRIDGE_BIT = 0x80) | (ATTEN_BIT = 0x40)

buttons.title: Get N2W Voltage - Activate Bridge Relay No Attenuation
buttons.description: arg2 = (N2W = 0x03) | (BRIDGE_BIT = 0x80) | (ATTEN_BIT = 0x40)

buttons.title: Do ADC Cmd: SELFOCAL
buttons.description: arg2 is the command SELFOCAL (self offset calibration)

buttons.title: Do ADC Cmd: SYSOCAL
buttons.description: arg2 is the command SYSOCAL (system offset calibration)

buttons.title: Do ADC Cmd: SYSGCAL
buttons.description: arg2 is the command SYSGCAL (system gain calibration)

buttons.title: Get N2E Voltage - Inactive Bridge Relay No Attenuation
buttons.description: arg2 = (N2E = 0x01) | (BRIDGE_BIT = 0x80) | (ATTEN_BIT = 0x40)

buttons.title: Get N2S Voltage - Inactive Bridge Relay No Attenuation
buttons.description: arg2 = (N2S = 0x02) | (BRIDGE_BIT = 0x80) | (ATTEN_BIT = 0x40)

buttons.title: Get N2W Voltage - Inactive Bridge Relay No Attenuation
buttons.description: arg2 = (N2W = 0x03) | (BRIDGE_BIT = 0x80) | (ATTEN_BIT = 0x40)

buttons.title: Get N2E Voltage - Inactive Bridge Relay w Attenuation
buttons.description: arg2 = (N2E = 0x01) | (BRIDGE_BIT = 0x80) | (ATTEN_BIT = 0x40)

buttons.title: Get N2S Voltage - Inactive Bridge Relay w Attenuation
buttons.description: arg2 = (N2S = 0x02) | (BRIDGE_BIT = 0x80) | (ATTEN_BIT = 0x40)

buttons.title: Get N2W Voltage - Inactive Bridge Relay w Attenuation
buttons.description: arg2 = (N2W = 0x03) | (BRIDGE_BIT = 0x80) | (ATTEN_BIT = 0x40)

buttons.title: Get E2S DC Current - Activate Bridge Relay No Attenuation
buttons.description: arg2 = (E2SDC = 0x06) | (BRIDGE_BIT = 0x80) | (ATTEN_BIT = 0x40)

buttons.title: Get E2S AC RMS Current - Activate Bridge Relay No Attenuation
buttons.description: arg2 = (E2SACRMS = 0x07) | (BRIDGE_BIT = 0x80) | (ATTEN_BIT = 0x40)

buttons.title: Step 1: Chain: N2E/S 3x Each UA & AT
buttons.description: First position N2E/S + BRG JPR

buttons.title: Step 2: Chain: N2W 3x Each UA & AT
buttons.description: Second position N2W

buttons.title: Step 3A/B: Chain: E2S 3x Each for DC AC (Repeat for uA mA)
buttons.description: Third position E2S

buttons.title: Get E2S DC Current - Bridge and Current Meas. Relays Inactive
buttons.description: For offset or zero calibration purposes ... arg2 = (E2SDC = 0x06) | (BRIDGE_BIT = 0x80) | (ATTEN_BIT = 0x40)

buttons.title: Get E2S AC RMS Current - Bridge and Current Meas. Relays Inactive
buttons.description: For offset or zero calibration purposes ... arg2 = (E2SACRMS = 0x07) | (BRIDGE_BIT = 0x80) | (ATTEN_BIT = 0x40)

buttons.title: Initialize DMM
buttons.description: Select ADMM First! arg2 = (E2SACRMS = 0x07) | (BRIDGE_BIT = 0x80) | (ATTEN_BIT = 0x40)

buttons.title: ADMPlex: Select ADMM1
buttons.description: arg2 = channel

buttons.title: ADMPlex: Select ADMM2
buttons.description: arg2 = channel

buttons.title: ADMPlex: Select ADMM3
buttons.description: arg2 = channel

buttons.title: ADMPlex: Select ADMM4
buttons.description: arg2 = channel

buttons.title: ADMPlex: Select No ADMMs
buttons.description: arg2 = channel

buttons.title: ADMM: All Relays Off
buttons.description: ADMM accessory command: De-energize all relays

buttons.title: Basic CH 1 Cont PAQ Setup Chain

command.description-summary: Command chain/sequence as implemented in UT software style Send Settings and PAC, without pulse shaping and duration controls.
description-detail: 4. Set HIVDC Tx voltage to nominal

buttons.description: Pulse and Acquire setting the Tx and Rx channels, and the Tx and Rx gains, oh and Rx delay too

buttons.title: Basic CH 2 Cont PAQ Setup Chain

command.description-summary: Command chain/sequence as implemented in UT software style Send Settings and PAC, without pulse shaping and duration controls.
description-detail: 4. Set HIVDC Tx voltage to nominal

buttons.description: Pulse and Acquire setting the Tx and Rx channels, and the Tx and Rx gains, oh and Rx delay too

buttons.title: Acquire 1-min Channel Scan To Single File...

command.description-summary: Command chain/sequence to set PAQ to continuous channel scan and stop after 2 minutes by putting the hardware back into single acquire mode.  You will need to set the Tx voltage and Rx gain separately.
description-detail: 0. Please set up Tx and Rx voltage/gain prior.
2. Stop continuous scan and switch back to single/manual acquisition mode.

buttons.description: Scan all channels continuously for 2 minutes and stores to single file.

value.note: 62899200 = 128 Hz (16 Hz/chan x 8 chans) * 4095 samples/waveform * 2 minutes (120 seconds)

buttons.title: Acquire Channel Scans To Split Batch Custom Files...

command.description-summary: Command chain/sequence to set PAQ to continuous channel scan and stop on cancel click. You will need to set the Tx voltage and Rx gain separately.
description-detail: 0. Please set up Tx and Rx voltage/gain prior.
???2. Stop continuous scan and switch back to single/manual acquisition mode.

comments.1: chainedCmdDelayMs will be overridden by a duration for each file based on capture options file specified scans per file and the waveform parser file specified waveform receive rate for the hardware.

buttons.description: Scan defined channels continuously until stop/cancel and split up into batch files using custom capture options.

value.note: 600 is 150 scans X 4 channels - eg per sample UTR type output file from specific user demo

buttons.title: Setup Cont PAQ Ch1-1
buttons.description: Setup Cont PAQ from RAM 0xF5 w/ Arg 1 = Tx Chan and Arg 2 = Rx Chan

buttons.title: Start Cont PAQ (Get WF)
buttons.description: 0xF6 Cont PAQ Control Arg 1 = 0x01 = Start

options.note: this should be first in options list

buttons.title: Stop Cont PAQ
buttons.description: 0xF6 Cont PAQ Control Arg 1 = 0x00 = Stop

buttons.title: Not Ready - Cont Acq Ch1-1 Setup & Run

command.description-summary: Command chain/sequence as implemented in UT software style Send Settings and PAC, without pulse shaping and duration controls.
description-detail: 1. Setup Cont PAQ from RAM 0xF5 w/ Arg 1 = Tx Chan and Arg 2 = Rx Chan
2. Start Cont PAQ 0xF6 w/ Arg 1 as 0x00 = Stop and Arg 1 as 0x01 = Start

buttons.description: Not ready as singleCaptureBuffer would only apply to last command - Cont PAQ setting the Tx and Rx channels from RAM - someday update options for multiple streams when fully implemented.
notes: 1. method for dl: setup with 0xf5 and then 0xf6 start called repeatedly
2. 0xf6 called and wait for wf i guess or timeout and then next iteration
3. until cancel after which same start contd paq w arg1 0x00 sent to stop is all

uiDataCaptureFocused.title: Acquire Channel Scans To Split Batch Custom Files

command.description-summary: Command chain/sequence to set PAQ to continuous channel scan and stop on cancel click. You will need to set the Tx voltage and Rx gain separately.
description-detail: 0. Please set up Tx and Rx voltage/gain prior.
???2. Stop continuous scan and switch back to single/manual acquisition mode.

comments.0: this is copied from the previous chained commands section as a template - same format is used to populate this ui customization
comments.1: chainedCmdDelayMs will be overridden for file writing purposes by a duration for each file based on capture options file specified scans per file and the waveform parser file specified waveform receive rate for the hardware.
comments.2: however, the second command will still fire, so if that second command tells the hardware to stop streaming, that'll happen.

uiDataCaptureFocused.description: Scan defined channels continuously until stop/cancel and split up into batch files using custom capture options.

notes: This defines chunk size multiple, the number of waveform-lengths, nominally, to include in the buffer readable event for the read stream buffer in the main window graph demo code.

It is also used in the data capture and user interface demo code to determine how much to decimate the UI data that gets pushed to the graph(s) to reduce UI overhead and prevent buffer processing overflows for display purposes.

That is, if too much data is pushed to the graph continuously, the graphable data buffer processing will fall behind and the buffer will continue to grow, basically towards overflowing, slowing the system down, or eating up memory.
In the UI code, for data focused capture, a value of 15 for example, might mean that every 16th waveform is pushed to its corresponding channel number graph.
Thus, at 128 waveforms per second spread through 8 channels, only graphing 4 of the 8 channels (a separate configuration to mimic legacy 4-channel systems for customization request by user),
every 128/16 = 8th waveform per second is pushed to a chart, and since there are 8 real channels, only 4 of which get graphed per this particular use case,
there is one waveform update to graph per channel per second.

value.note: 600 is 150 scans X 4 channels - eg per sample UTR type output file from specific user demo

uiDataCaptureFocused.title: Set PAQ Mode Continuous Channel Scan
uiDataCaptureFocused.description: Scan defined channels continuously until stop/cancel and split up into batch files using custom capture options.

notes: This defines chunk size multiple, the number of waveform-lengths, nominally, to include in the buffer readable event for the read stream buffer in the main window graph demo code.

It is also used in the data capture and user interface demo code to determine how much to decimate the UI data that gets pushed to the graph(s) to reduce UI overhead and prevent buffer processing overflows for display purposes.

That is, if too much data is pushed to the graph continuously, the graphable data buffer processing will fall behind and the buffer will continue to grow, basically towards overflowing, slowing the system down, or eating up memory.
In the UI code, for data focused capture, a value of 15 for example, might mean that every 16th waveform is pushed to its corresponding channel number graph.
Thus, at 128 waveforms per second spread through 8 channels, only graphing 4 of the 8 channels (a separate configuration to mimic legacy 4-channel systems for customization request by user),
every 128/16 = 8th waveform per second is pushed to a chart, and since there are 8 real channels, only 4 of which get graphed per this particular use case,
there is one waveform update to graph per channel per second.

value.note: 600 is 150 scans X 4 channels - eg per sample UTR type output file from specific user demo

uiDataCaptureFocused.title: Set PAQ Mode (Back to) Single (Not continuous)
uiDataCaptureFocused.description: Set PAQ mode to single pulse and acquire
